maml:description.maml:para: Generate an email object in a 'Notifies' block.
Generate an email object in a 'Notifies' block.
This is not intended to be used anywhere but inside a 'Notifies' block inside a Watchmen file. Directly calling the 'Email' function outside of a 'Notifies' block will throw an error.

The 'Subject' and Message' fields inside the hashtable for this function support string interpolation. The following keywords can be placed inside the Subject or Message strings using the convetion #{<keyword>}. When the Email notifier is executed these placeholders will be replaced with values from the test result:

computername - Computer name test was executed on module - OVF module name file - Path to Pester test executed descibe - Name of 'Describe' block in Pester test context - Name of 'Context' block in Pester test test - Name of 'It' block in Pester test result - Result of test. 'Passed' or 'Failed' failureMessage - Failure message from Pester test duration - Duration of Pester test
Example: subject = 'Watchmen alert - #{computername} - [#{test}] failed!'

maml:Description.maml:para: Hashtable of values needed to send an SMTP email.

[string]FromAddress - REQUIRED - From address for email [string[]]To - REQUIRED - Array of email addresses to send to [string]SMTPServer - REQUIRED - SMTP server FQDN or IP address [int]Port - REQUIRED - SMTP port (usually 25) [string]Subject - OPTIONAL - Subject for email [string]Message - OPTIONAL - Message for email [pscredential]Credential - OPTIONAL - Credential to authenticate to SMTP server with [bool]UseSSL - OPTINOAL - Use SSL when connecting to SMTP server
Hashtable of values needed to send an SMTP email.

[string]FromAddress - REQUIRED - From address for email [string[]]To - REQUIRED - Array of email addresses to send to [string]SMTPServer - REQUIRED - SMTP server FQDN or IP address [int]Port - REQUIRED - SMTP port (usually 25) [string]Subject - OPTIONAL - Subject for email [string]Message - OPTIONAL - Message for email [pscredential]Credential - OPTIONAL - Credential to authenticate to SMTP server with [bool]UseSSL - OPTINOAL - Use SSL when connecting to SMTP server

maml:description.maml:para: Reads one or more Watchmen files and returns the test objects.
Reads one or more Watchmen files and returns the test objects.

maml:Description.maml:para: Path to to a Watchmen file or a folder containing Watchmen files.
If a path to a folder is given, only files with a *.watchmen.ps1 convention are processed.
Recursively read in Watchmen files from given path.
Only Watchmen files with a *.watchmen.ps1 convention are processed.
Path to to a Watchmen file or a folder containing Watchmen files.
If a path to a folder is given, only files with a *.watchmen.ps1 convention are processed.
Recursively read in Watchmen files from given path.
Only Watchmen files with a *.watchmen.ps1 convention are processed.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $tests = Get-WatchmenTest -Path c:\watchmen\my.watchmen.ps1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Reads in the Watchmen file c:\watchmen\my.watchmen.ps1

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $allTests = Get-WatchmenTest -Path c:\watchmen -Recurse

dev:remarks.maml:para: Recursively reads in Watchmen files from path c:\watchmen

maml:description.maml:para: Execute one or more Watchmen objects representing OVF tests.

Execute one or more Watchmen objects representing OVF tests. Upon any failing tests, Watchmen will optionally execute a number of notifier actions such as sending en email, or writing to the event log.

maml:Description.maml:para: Do not run any notifiers upon failing OVF tests.
Display Pester output of tests contained in OVF modules.
Watchmen object representing tests and notifiers to execute.
Do not run any notifiers upon failing OVF tests.
Display Pester output of tests contained in OVF modules.
One or more paths to Watchmen files, or folders containing Watchmen files.
Recursively search for Watchmen files inside given path.
Do not run any notifiers upon failing OVF tests.
Display Pester output of tests contained in OVF modules.
Watchmen object representing tests and notifiers to execute.
One or more paths to Watchmen files, or folders containing Watchmen files.
Recursively search for Watchmen files inside given path.

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Invoke-WatchmenTest -Path c:\watchmen\my.watchmen.ps1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Invoke All OVF tests defined in Watchmen file c:\watchmen\my.watchmen.ps1

command:example.maml:title: Example 2
command:example.dev:code: $tests = Get-WatchmenTest -Path c:\watchmen\my.watchmen.ps1 $tests | Invoke-WatchmenTest -Verbose

dev:remarks.maml:para: Read in Watchmen objects and pass via the pipeline to Invoke-WatchmenTest with verbose output.

command:example.maml:title: Example 3
command:example.dev:code: $results = Get-WatchmenTest -Path c:\watchmen\my.watchmen.ps1 | Invoke-WatchmenTest -Verbose -IncludePesterOutpull -PassTru

dev:remarks.maml:para: Include Pester output and return test results

command:example.maml:title: Example 4
command:example.dev:code: Invoke-WatchmenTest -Path c:\watchmen -Recurse -Verbose -IncludePesterOutput -DisableNotifiers

dev:remarks.maml:para: Recursively read Watchmen files in c:\watchmen, execute the tests, but do not run any notifier actions.
